smarty.preprocessing package¶

Package allowing to easily prepare both categorical and numerical data for further analysis.

smarty.preprocessing.categorical module¶

Categorical data preprocessing.

class smarty.preprocessing.categorical.OneHotEncoder[source]¶

Bases: object

Performs One Hot Encoding on data fed to .fit(). All variables are available after calling .fit() method, which returns OneHotEncoder instance itself.

Variables:

  • encoders_ (list of dictionaries) – list of dictionaries, dict on index i is a map of value -> one hot for a column i

  • decoders_ (list of dictionaries) – inversion of encoders_, maps one hot -> original value

  • classes_ (list of str) – list of column names

Note

.fit() method needs to be called first.

fit(cols)[source]¶

Prepares an one-hot map for each column of cols.

Parameters:

cols (np.ndarray) – 2D array, where axis-1 are rows

Raises:

AssertionError if Encoder was already fitted

fit_transform(cols)[source]¶

Fits Encoder with cols and returns their one-hot representation. (calls .fit() than .transform())

Parameters:

cols (np.ndarray) – 2D array, where axis-1 are rows

Warning

Unlike .fit(), this method will not return OneHotEncoder itself, it should be initialized first if you don’t want to loose the maps.

transform(cols)[source]¶

Transforms cols into one-hots according to maps created in .fit()

Parameters:

cols (np.ndarray) – 2D array, where axis-1 are rows

Raises:

AssertionError if Encoder wasn’t fitted or number of columns in cols is different than that in .fit()

Danger

Function will crash if any value in cols wasn’t seen by .fit() method. (wasn’t map into encoders_)

translate(cols)[source]¶

Translates one-hots back to the original value

Parameters:

cols (np.ndarray) – 2D array, where axis-1 are rows

Raises:

AssertionError if Encoder wasn’t fitted or number of columns in cols is different than that in .fit()

Danger

Function will crash if any value in cols wasn’t seen by .fit() method. (wasn’t mapped into decoders_)

smarty.preprocessing.numerical module¶

Numerical data preprocessing.

class smarty.preprocessing.numerical.StandardScaler(strategy='standarize')[source]¶

Bases: object

Performs basic numerical data preprocessing according to choosen stategy. All variables are available after calling .fit() method, which returns StandardScaler instance itself.

Parameters:

strategy (str) – “normalize” for data normalization or “standarize” for data standarization

Variables:

  • strategies_ (list) – List of avalibable strategies

  • solver._num_cols_ (int) – Number of columns provided in .fit() method

  • solver.stds_ (np.ndarray) – List containing each column standard deviation, available only with strategy=”standarize”

  • solver.means_ (np.ndarray) – List containing each column mean, available only with strategy=”standarize”

  • solver.mins_ (np.ndarray) – List containing each column minimum value, available only with strategy=”normalize”

  • solver.maxs_ (np.ndarray) – List containing each column maximum value, available only with strategy=”normalize”

Note

.fit() method needs to be called first.

fit(cols)[source]¶

Calculates neccesery statistical data to perform later transformations.

Parameters:

cols (np.ndarray) – 2D array, where axis-1 are rows

Raises:

AssertionError if Encoder was already fitted

fit_transform(cols)[source]¶

Fits Scaler with cols and returns their one-hot representation. (calls .fit() than .transform())

Parameters:

cols (np.ndarray) – 2D array, where axis-1 are rows

Warning

Unlike .fit(), this method will not return StandardScaler itself, it should be initialized first if you want to save the stats for later use.

transform(cols)[source]¶

Transforms cols according to choosen strategy.

Parameters:

cols (np.ndarray) – 2D array, where axis-1 are rows

Raises:

AssertionError if Encoder wasn’t fitted or number of columns in cols is different than that in .fit()

Danger

Function will crash if any value in cols wasn’t seen by .fit() method. (wasn’t map into encoders_)

translate(cols)[source]¶

Translates preprocessed data as close as possible to their original values

Parameters:

cols (np.ndarray) – 2D array, where axis-1 are rows

Raises:

AssertionError if Encoder wasn’t fitted or number of columns in cols is different than that in .fit()
